children.subject: Have sent you an email! Thank you so much!

history.content:
Hi all! I am reaching out to see if anyone is interested in a full-time internship at Oracle as an Application Developer for the Mergers & Acquisitions group. I am currently in this role, but am looking for a replacement after I graduate at the end of the semester. You can begin this summer and continue working into the school year (for reference, I started June 2021 and am still there now!).

We are looking to find a new intern ASAP, so please reach out if you feel that you would be a good fit for the role. You can send your resume to me at mayarraman@berkeley.edu. Feel free to e-mail me with any questions you have about the position and I can try my best to answer them.

Job Description:

Title: Mergers & Acquisition Application Developer Internship

Location: Redwood Shores, CA (Bay Area), Hybrid

Business Unit: Global Controllers Office

This is a full-time, paid, internship (Potential up to 6 months+) The work schedule is Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week.

Start Date: May/June 2022

This highly visible position is located in Oracle's office in Redwood Shores. The M&A Application Developer Intern will work closely with Finance Mergers and Acquisition Integration Office to design and develop specialized applications to automate or streamline existing integration processes. The intern will work to create database applications that will automate the formatting, data collecting, graphing, of financial and historical data related to acquisitions. In addition, the intern will be expected to interview and gather business requirements from key stakeholders within the finance organization as well as train and educate users on how to use the new applications. The intern is responsible for accomplishing tasks in a complete and timely manner, as well as providing weekly updates.

Responsibilities
•The intern will work to create database applications that will automate the formatting, data collecting, graphing, of financial and historical data related to acquisitions
•In addition, the intern will be expected to interview and gather business requirements from key stakeholders within the finance organization as well as train and educate users on how to use the new applications
•The intern is responsible for accomplishing tasks in a complete and timely manner, as well as providing weekly updates


Preferred Skills and Qualifications:
• Expecting a BA/BS in or MS in Computer Science, MIS, Math, Physics, Operations research, Economics, Finance, Accounting or related field
• Exposure with databases, building a website, and graphical user interfaces using SQL, MySQL, HTML, JavaScript for UI
• Innovative problem solving, analytical and decision making skills
• Ability to meet strict deadlines and work under pressure
• Willingness and ability to work extended hours
• Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
• Demonstrated strong knowledge and use of Excel
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Attention to details
• Capacity to learn quickly, adapt to change and work in an objective driven environment;
• Prior app development/programming experience and/or familiarity with Oracle Databases, accounting systems (eg. QuickBooks) are a plus.
history.subject: [Job Opportunity] Oracle Application Developer Intern
